# pushItem(_:animated:)

**Instance Method**

Pushes the given navigation item onto the navigation bar’s stack and updates the UI.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func pushItem(_ item: UINavigationItem, animated: Bool)
```

## Parameters

- **item**: The navigation item to push on the stack.
- **animated**: [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the navigation bar should be animated; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

Pushing a navigation item displays the item’s title in the center on the navigation bar. The previous top navigation item (if it exists) is displayed as a Back button on the left side of the navigation bar. If the new top item has a left custom view, it is displayed instead of the back button.

## Pushing and popping items

- **popItem(animated:)**: Pops the top item from the navigation bar’s stack and updates the UI.
- **setItems(_:animated:)**: Replaces the navigation items currently managed by the navigation bar with the specified items.
- **items**: An array of navigation items managed by the navigation bar.
- **topItem**: The navigation item at the top of the navigation bar’s stack.
- **backItem**: The navigation item that is immediately below the topmost item on a navigation bar’s stack.
